title: Based on the equation 9ax + 9b − 6 = 21, what is the value of ax + b? - Quora

response.answer_text: We have, given the equation, =9ax + 9b − 6 = 21 =9ax+9b=21+6 =9ax+9b=27 Dividing the whole equation by 9 We get =ax+b=3 So, 3 is the answer.
ITS EASY U NEED TO TAKE ALL THE COMMON FACTOR OUT!!!! 9ax+9b-6=21 divide by 3 3ax +3b-2 =7 3ax+3b=9 divide by 3 again ax+b=3
